intro: Casearia euceraea, commonly known as the white casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and herbal medicine research.
